place.name: BERGH APTON
place.gazetteerText: BURGH-APTON, or Bergh-Apton, a parish in Loddon district, Norfolk, 2½ miles SSW of Buckenham r. station, and 3 NW of Loddon. It has a post office, of the name of Bergh-Apton, under Norwich. Acres, 1,620. Real property, £3,931. Pop., 544. Houses, 129. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory, united with the rectory of Holverstone, in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £573.* Patron, the Earl of Abergavenny. The church has a lofty tower, and is good. There are a national school, and charities £117. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
